content.description: Stand start with a right hand incut edge and a left hand on the arete. From there, bump the left hand up the arete, set up the feet, reach a sharp left hand edge, follow to a right hand sidepull, bump the same hand up to a shallow pocket, reach a left hand edge, gain the good bumps, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a great landing aside from a few rocks that surround the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the north side of Sweetum's northeast arete.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, climb the slab using the edges and arete to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two will work well. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the east side of Sweetum's northeast arete.

content.description: Sit start with a big, left hand sidepull and a low, right hand block. From there, reach a right hand edge, bump from there to a right hand sidepull, bump it further up to another sidepull, gain a left hand edge, set and dyno to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is uneven due to a rock, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the west section of Sweetum's north face.

content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, reach a right hand crimp, follow to a left hand incut-circle edge, bring the feet along, stand up to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there is a rock behind it.
content.location: It climbs just to the left of Sweetum on Sweetum's east face.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the generous rail. From there, stand up tall to the hueco, match on it, gain a right hand edge, follow to the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pad or two. The immediate landing is great, but there is a tree root and a rock behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Sweetum.
